00036 #define SIGNALMASK_UNFILLED (~(uint64)0)

00044 class SIM_API cComponent : public cDefaultList //implies noncopyable
00045 {
00046     friend class cPar; // needs to call handleParameterChange()
00047     friend class cChannel; // allow it to access FL_INITIALIZED and releaseLocalListeners()
00048     friend class cModule; // allow it to access FL_INITIALIZED, releaseLocalListeners() and repairSignalFlags()
00049     friend class cGate;   // because of repairSignalFlags()
00050 
00051   private:
00052     enum {
00053       FL_PARAMSFINALIZED = 4,   // whether finalizeParameters() has been called
00054       FL_INITIALIZED = 8,       // whether initialize() has been called
00055       FL_EVLOGENABLED = 16,     // whether logging via ev<< is enabled
00056       FL_DISPSTR_CHECKED = 32,  // for hasDisplayString(): whether the FL_DISPSTR_NOTEMPTY flag is valid
00057       FL_DISPSTR_NOTEMPTY = 64, // for hasDisplayString(): whether the display string is not empty
00058     };
00059 
00060   private:
00061     cComponentType *componenttype;  // component type object
00062 
00063     short rngmapsize;  // size of rngmap array (RNGs>=rngmapsize are mapped one-to-one to physical RNGs)
00064     int *rngmap;       // maps local RNG numbers (may be NULL if rngmapsize==0)
00065 
00066     short paramvsize;
00067     short numparams;
00068     cPar *paramv;  // array of cPar objects
00069 
00070     cDisplayString *dispstr; // display string (created on demand)
00071 
00072     struct SignalData
00073     {
00074         simsignal_t signalID;
00075         cIListener **listeners; // NULL-terminated array
00076 
00077         SignalData() {signalID=SIMSIGNAL_NULL; listeners=NULL;}
00078         bool addListener(cIListener *l);
00079         bool removeListener(cIListener *l);
00080         int findListener(cIListener *l);
00081         int countListeners();
00082         bool hasListener() {return listeners && listeners[0];}
00083         static bool gt(const SignalData& e1, const SignalData& e2) {return e1.signalID > e2.signalID;}
00084     };
00085 
00086     typedef std::vector<SignalData> SignalTable;
00087     SignalTable *signalTable; // ordered by signalID so we can do binary search
00088 
00089     // flags to speed up emit() for signals 0..63 when there are no or few listeners
00090     uint64 signalHasLocalListeners;    // bit[k]==1: signalID k has local listeners
00091     uint64 signalHasAncestorListeners; // bit[k]==1: signalID k has listener in parent or in any ancestor component
00092 
00093     // string-to-simsignal_t mapping
00094     static struct SignalNameMapping {
00095         std::map<std::string,simsignal_t> signalNameToID;
00096         std::map<simsignal_t,std::string> signalIDToName;
00097     } *signalNameMapping;  // must be dynamically allocated on first access so that registerSignal() can be invoked from static initialization code
00098     static int lastSignalID;
00099 
00100     // dynamic assignment of signalHasLocalListeners/signalHasAncestorListeners bits (64 of them) to signalIDs
00101     static std::vector<uint64> signalMasks;  // index: signalID, value: mask (1<<bitIndex), or 0xffff... for "unfilled"
00102     static int firstFreeSignalMaskBitIndex; // 0..63; 64 means "all sold out"
00103 
00104     // stack of listener lists being notified, to detect concurrent modification
00105     static cIListener **notificationStack[];
00106     static int notificationSP;
00107 
00108   private:
00109     SignalData *findSignalData(simsignal_t signalID) const;
00110     SignalData *findOrCreateSignalData(simsignal_t signalID);
00111     void removeSignalData(simsignal_t signalID);
00112     void checkNotFiring(simsignal_t, cIListener **listenerList);
00113     template<typename T> void fire(cComponent *src, simsignal_t signalID, const uint64& mask, T x);
00114     void fireFinish();
00115     void signalListenerAdded(simsignal_t signalID, uint64 mask);
00116     void signalListenerRemoved(simsignal_t signalID, uint64 mask);
00117     void repairSignalFlags();
00118     bool computeHasListeners(simsignal_t signalID) const;
00119     void releaseLocalListeners();

00122     // internal: currently used by Cmdenv
00123     void setEvEnabled(bool e)  {setFlag(FL_EVLOGENABLED,e);}
00124     bool isEvEnabled() const  {return flags&FL_EVLOGENABLED;}

00126     // internal: invoked from within cEnvir::getRNGMappingFor(component)
00127     void setRNGMap(short size, int *map) {rngmapsize=size; rngmap=map;}

00129     // internal: sets associated cComponentType for the component;

00131     virtual void setComponentType(cComponentType *componenttype);

00140     virtual void recordParametersAsScalars();

00142     // internal: has finalizeParameters() been called?
00143     bool parametersFinalized() const {return flags&FL_PARAMSFINALIZED;}
00144 
00145     // internal: has initialize() been called?
00146     bool initialized() const {return flags&FL_INITIALIZED;}
00147 
00148     // internal: used from Tkenv: find out if this module has a display string.
00149     // getDisplayString() would create the object immediately which we want to avoid.
00150     bool hasDisplayString();
00151 
00152     // internal: checks consistency of signal listener flags
00153     void checkLocalSignalConsistency() const;
00154     void checkSignalConsistency() const;
00155 
00156     // internal: clears global signals-related data structures; to be invoked before each simulation run
00157     static void clearSignalState();
00158 
00159     // internal: allocates a signalHasLocalListeners/signalHasAncestorListeners bit index to the
00160     // given signal and returns the corresponding mask (1<<index); returns 0 if there are no more
00161     // free bit indices. Result is remembered and returned in subsequent calls (until clearSignalState())
00162     static uint64 getSignalMask(simsignal_t signalID);

00484     bool mayHaveListeners(simsignal_t signalID) const {
00485         uint64 mask = getSignalMask(signalID);
00486         return (~signalHasLocalListeners & ~signalHasAncestorListeners & mask)==0; // always true for mask==0
00487     }
00488 
00496     bool hasListeners(simsignal_t signalID) const {
00497         uint64 mask = getSignalMask(signalID);
00498         return mask ? ((signalHasLocalListeners|signalHasAncestorListeners) & mask) : computeHasListeners(signalID);
00499     }
